s1: Cyber Security Foundations introduces all essential cyber security principles.
This includes principles of secure design, secrets minimization, least privilege, isolation, separation and encapsulation.
s2: This includes an overview of relevant network protocols and cryptography; analyses of designs and implementations of security protocols, including basic tools and techniques; an understanding of network threats and attacks such as eavesdropping, spoofing, protocol failures, DoS attacks and man-in-the-middle attacks; network defence including threat analysis and identification, architecture control, intrusion detection and layered security.

s1: The interplay between failed security principles and vulnerabilities is investigated in detail.
s2: Understand various threats and vulnerabilities of a network, and explain appropriate countermeasures.

s1: The course provides the essential foundations which allow students to continue in a more in-depth cyber security career, yet can also be used a standalone unit to provide a self-contained set of knowledge.
s2: The course features hands-on lectures and labs to analyse network vulnerabilities, and design and implement appropriate defensive techniques.

s1: Demonstrate a thorough understanding of the fundamental principles underlying Cyber Security.
s2: The course features hands-on lectures and labs to analyse network vulnerabilities, and design and implement appropriate defensive techniques.

s1: Define and identify cyber security principles and their violation.
Apply cyber security principles in a practical context.
Migrate insights from cyber security analysis into new designs.
s2: The course features hands-on lectures and labs to analyse network vulnerabilities, and design and implement appropriate defensive techniques.

s1: Communicate a cyber security thread to a heterogenous team of professionals.
s2: The course features hands-on lectures and labs to analyse network vulnerabilities, and design and implement appropriate defensive techniques.
